bestBHT.bht: This revealing declaration delves into Jesus' impending sufferings and death, including His delivery to the Gentiles. It implies a double betrayal, first by His friends to His enemies and then by His own people to the Gentiles. The prediction is fulfilled in remarkable detail, from the mocking and scourging to the crucifixion. Jesus approaches His fate with divine strength and the power of the Spirit. While His disciples may not fully comprehend, they find hope in the fulfillment of the prophetic writings regarding the Son of Man's condemned death.

Henry Alford: Mark x. 32–34. Luke xviii. 31–34. FULLER DECLARATION OF HIS SUFFERINGS AND DEATH—revealing His being delivered to the Gentiles—
John Calvin: Hence we perceive that Christ was endued with divine fortitude for overcoming the terrors of death, for he knowingly and willingly hastens to undergo it.
For why does he, without any constraint, march forward to suffer a shocking murder, but because the invincible power of the Spirit enabled him to subdue fear, and raised him above all human feelings?
But as it was necessary that His death should go before, he makes their triumph, in the meantime, to consist in hope.
Philip Schaff: A double betrayal is implied: first by His professed friends to His declared enemies; then by His own people to the Gentiles.
To mock, and to scourge, and to crucify. Fulfilled in every detail.
The request of Salome indicates that the disciples did not understand the prediction as a whole, plain as it is to us.
John Gill: all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man, shall be accomplished
and the Son of man shall be betrayed
they shall condemn him to death

bhtAttempts.bht: This verse reveals a fuller declaration of Jesus' impending sufferings and death, including His being delivered to the Gentiles. It implies a double betrayal, first by His professed friends to His declared enemies, and then by His own people to the Gentiles. This prediction is fulfilled in every detail, from the mocking and scourging to the crucifixion. Despite the disciples' lack of understanding, Jesus willingly marches forward to suffer, endued with divine fortitude and the invincible power of the Spirit. Though His death must come first, their triumph is to be found in the hope of the fulfillment of all that is written by the prophets. Ultimately, the Son of Man shall be betrayed and condemned to death.

This revealing passage delves into Jesus' forthcoming sufferings and death, where He will be delivered to the Gentiles. It highlights a double betrayal, first by His friends to His enemies and then by His own people to the Gentiles. Every detail of the prediction, from the mockery to the crucifixion, comes to pass. Jesus approaches His brutal fate with divine fortitude and the power of the Spirit. While His disciples may not fully understand, they find hope in the fulfillment of the prophetic writings about the Son of Man's condemnation to death.

The prediction is fulfilled in remarkable detail, from the mocking and scourging to the crucifixion. Jesus approaches His fate with divine strength and the power of the Spirit. This revealing declaration delves into Jesus' impending sufferings and death, including His being delivered to the Gentiles. It implies a double betrayal, first by His friends to His enemies and then by His own people to the Gentiles. The prediction is fulfilled in every detail, from the mocking and scourging to the crucifixion. Jesus approaches His fate with divine fortitude, enabled by the invincible power of the Spirit that helps Him subdue fear and rise above human feelings. Though His death must come first, their triumph lies in the hope of the fulfillment of the prophetic writings about the Son of Man's condemnation to death.

This revealing declaration pertains to Jesus' forthcoming sufferings and death, involving His delivery to the Gentiles. It suggests a dual betrayal - first by His friends to His enemies, then by His own people to the Gentiles. Every aspect of this prophecy comes to pass, from the mockery and scourging to the crucifixion. Jesus, fortified by divine fortitude and the invincible power of the Spirit, willingly embraces His grim fate, paving the way for their ultimate triumph rooted in hope and the fulfillment of ancient prophetic scriptures.
